Package utils

Class DSA

java.lang.Object
utils.DSA
public class DSA extends Object
The DSA class provides utility methods for generating DSA key pairs, signing and verifying digital signatures, and handling public key operations.

    • generateDSAKeyPair

      public static KeyPair generateDSAKeyPair()
      Generates a DSA key pair.
      Returns:
      The generated DSA key pair.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If an error occurs during key pair generation.

    • writePubKeyToRegistry

      public static void writePubKeyToRegistry(Address myAddress, PublicKey key)
      Writes the public key to a registry file.
      Parameters:
      myAddress - The address associated with the public key.
      key - The public key to be written to the registry.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If an error occurs while writing the public key to the registry.

    • signHash

      public static byte[] signHash(String hash, PrivateKey key)
      Signs a hash using the provided private key.
      Parameters:
      hash - The hash to be signed.
      key - The private key used for signing.
      Returns:
      The digital signature.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If an error occurs during the signing process.

    • verifySignature

      public static boolean verifySignature(String hash, byte[] signature, byte[] publicKey)
      Verifies a digital signature using the provided public key.
      Parameters:
      hash - The hash to be verified.
      signature - The digital signature to be verified.
      publicKey - The public key used for verification.
      Returns:
      True if the signature is valid, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If an error occurs during the verification process.

    • verifySignatureFromRegistry

      public static boolean verifySignatureFromRegistry(String hash, byte[] signature, Address address)
      Verifies a digital signature using the public key obtained from the registry.
      Parameters:
      hash - The hash to be verified.
      signature - The digital signature to be verified.
      address - The address associated with the public key in the registry.
      Returns:
      True if the signature is valid, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If an error occurs during the verification process.

      Converts a Base64-encoded string to a byte array.

      byteString - The Base64-encoded string.
      Returns:
      The corresponding byte array.
